nodes.bodyText: When I tried LOGGER, it said the name of the field would conflict with the logger in RconClient
It's a known Enigma bug, the only solution right now is to edit the name in the mapping file directly. Static fields or methods don't conflict with parent/child classes
don't need title prefix in the last 3 params
nodes.diffHunk:

@@ -1,4 +1,7 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1133 net/minecraft/server/LanServerPinger + COMMENT Used to send UDP multicasts, which notify other clients of a local game on the same network. + COMMENT + COMMENT

These multicasts will always be sent to {@code 224.0.2.60:4445} where other clients can listen for local games.

nodes.bodyText: consider using blockquote pre tags and unordered/ordered lists

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		ARG 3 titleFadeIn
          
          
            
            		ARG 4 titleRemain
          
          
            
            		ARG 5 titleFadeOut
          
          
            
            		ARG 3 fadeInTicks
          
          
            
            		ARG 4 remainTicks
          
          
            
            		ARG 5 fadeOutTicks
          
      
    
    
  

You removed the suffix, not the prefix
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -74,9 +74,9 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_329 net/minecraft/client/gui/hud/InGameHud
 	METHOD method_1763 setTitles (Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;III)V
 		ARG 1 title
 		ARG 2 subtitle
-		ARG 3 titleFadeInTicks
-		ARG 4 titleRemainTicks
-		ARG 5 titleFadeOutTicks
+		ARG 3 titleFadeIn
+		ARG 4 titleRemain
+		ARG 5 titleFadeOut

nodes.bodyText: How does this differentiate from other logging methods?
Logs a message to the dedicated server hosting the rcon connection
You use argumentName elsewhere, so this should be argumentClass to be consistent.
